net.sf.openrds
Class RegistryHandler

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.openrds.RegistryHandler
public final class RegistryHandler
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for the RMI Registry control. It is able to start a new registry, control objects on that register and finish it when necessary.

Author:
Rodrigo

Field Summary
static int HTTP_PORT
          Default port for the Http Daemon used for dynamic class downloads
static int REGISTRY_PORT
          Default port for the RMI Registry
 
Method Summary
 void finish()
          Unbinds any object remaining on the started RMI Registry (if any) and closes the started http daemon.
Note that if the registry has been started, it will be still alive after calling this method, since the RMI does not provide any way for stopping an started registry.
 java.net.InetAddress getInetAddress()
          Retrieves InetAddress that is being used by OpenRDS.
static RegistryHandler getInstance()
          Retrieves the singleton instance of this class
 IMainNode getMainNode()
          Retrieves a remote reference for the system's main node, if available.
 void initialize()
          Initializes a new RMI registry on the current JVM, on the default port.
The initialized registry will have access to all classes available in the classpath of this JVM.
Note that this will also start an http daemon for answering remote "Dynamic Class Download" requests on the default port.
Calling this method has the same effect of calling initialize(REGISTRY_PORT, HTTP_PORT)
This method is NOT thread safe, results of two threads trying to access it at the same time are unpredictable.
 void initialize(int registryPort, int httpPort)
          Initializes a new RMI registry on the current JVM, on the given registry port.
The initialized registry will have access to all classes available in the classpath of this JVM.
Note that this will also start an http daemon for answering remote "Dynamic Class Download" requests on the given http port.
This method is NOT thread safe, results of two threads trying to access it at the same time are unpredictable.

          Sets a remote rmi registry to be controlled.
Calling this method has the same effect of calling initialize(remoteRegistryHost, REGISTRY_PORT, HTTP_PORT).

          Registers the given node on the RMI registry.
After calling this method that node will be available to any remote machine thru the registry.

Method Detail

getInetAddress

public java.net.InetAddress getInetAddress()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Retrieves InetAddress that is being used by OpenRDS. This takes in consideration the System-Property "openrds.base.ip" (if it's set).

Returns:
InetAddress
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on any error getting network interfaces
Since:
OpenRDS 1.1-beta

initialize

public void initialize()
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       java.io.IOException
Initializes a new RMI registry on the current JVM, on the default port.
The initialized registry will have access to all classes available in the classpath of this JVM.
Note that this will also start an http daemon for answering remote "Dynamic Class Download" requests on the default port.
Calling this method has the same effect of calling initialize(REGISTRY_PORT, HTTP_PORT)
This method is NOT thread safe, results of two threads trying to access it at the same time are unpredictable.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error prevented the registry startup
java.io.IOException - if any error prevented the http daemon startup
See Also:
REGISTRY_PORT, HTTP_PORT

initialize

public void initialize(int registryPort,
                       int httpPort)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       java.io.IOException
Initializes a new RMI registry on the current JVM, on the given registry port.
The initialized registry will have access to all classes available in the classpath of this JVM.
Note that this will also start an http daemon for answering remote "Dynamic Class Download" requests on the given http port.
This method is NOT thread safe, results of two threads trying to access it at the same time are unpredictable.

Parameters:
registryPort - port to bind RMI registry to, or -1 if the registry should not be started.
httpPort - port to bind http daemon to, or -1 if the daemon should not be started
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error prevented the registry startup
java.io.IOException - if any error prevented the http daemon startup

initialize

public void initialize(java.lang.String remoteHost,
                       int registryPort,
                       int httpPort)
                throws java.io.IOException
Sets a remote rmi registry to be controlled. This method will never start an http daemon it will just setup a property to allow dynamic class downloads from an http server running on httpPort.
This method is NOT thread safe, results of two threads trying to access it at the same time are unpredictable.

Parameters:
remoteHost - host-name or ip of the remote registry
registryPort - remote registry port number
httpPort - remote http port for dynamic class downloads, or -1 if not allowed.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on any IO error

initialize

public void initialize(java.lang.String remoteRegistryHost)
                throws java.io.IOException
Sets a remote rmi registry to be controlled.
Calling this method has the same effect of calling initialize(remoteRegistryHost, REGISTRY_PORT, HTTP_PORT).

Parameters:
remoteRegistryHost - host-name or ip of the remote registry
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on any IO error
See Also:
initialize(String, int, int)

finish

public void finish()
Unbinds any object remaining on the started RMI Registry (if any) and closes the started http daemon.
Note that if the registry has been started, it will be still alive after calling this method, since the RMI does not provide any way for stopping an started registry.

registerNode

public void registerNode(INode node)
                  throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         NodeAlreadyExistsException,
                         RegistryNotActiveException
Registers the given node on the RMI registry.
After calling this method that node will be available to any remote machine thru the registry.

Parameters:
node - node to register
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - RemoteException if remote communication with the registry failed; if exception is a ServerException containing an AccessException, then the registry denies the caller access to perform this operation (if originating from a non-local host, for example)
java.rmi.AccessException - if this registry is local and it denies the caller access to perform this operation
NodeAlreadyExistsException - if another node with the same name is already registered on the RMI registry
RegistryNotActiveException - if the registry has not been initialized

unregisterNode

public void unregisterNode(INode node)
                    throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                           java.rmi.RemoteException,
                           RegistryNotActiveException
Removes the given node from the registry (if registered).

Parameters:
node - node to remove from registry
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - RemoteException if remote communication with the registry failed; if exception is a ServerException containing an AccessException, then the registry denies the caller access to perform this operation (if originating from a non-local host, for example)
java.rmi.AccessException - if this registry is local and it denies the caller access to perform this operation
RegistryNotActiveException - if the registry has not been initialized

getMainNode

public IMainNode getMainNode()
                      throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                             java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             java.rmi.NotBoundException,
                             RegistryNotActiveException
Retrieves a remote reference for the system's main node, if available.

Returns:
IMainNode registered at RMI Registry
Throws:
java.rmi.NotBoundException - if the main node hasn't been found on registry
java.rmi.RemoteException - if remote communication with the registry failed; if exception is a ServerException containing an AccessException, then the registry denies the caller access to perform this operation
java.rmi.AccessException - if this registry is local and it denies the caller access to perform this operation
RegistryNotActiveException - if the registry has not been initialized

getInstance

public static RegistryHandler getInstance()
Retrieves the singleton instance of this class

Returns:
RegistryHandler singleton
